info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 8:33PM EDT until April 01 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN BERKS...CENTRAL LEHIGH AND SOUTHWESTERN NORTHAMPTON COUNTIES... At 832 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Blairstown to near Allentown, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported a tree down in Perry Township at 7:44 PM in Berks County. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Bethlehem, Emmaus, Northampton, Hellertown, Kutztown, Fleetwood, Laureldale, Topton, Bally, Bechtelsville, Lyons, Coffeetown, Zionsville, Ancient Oaks, Lehigh University, Claussville, Schnecksville, Catasauqua and Fountain Hill. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 48 and 63. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 46 and 71. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
